edu.uw.cs.cse461.net.tcpmessagehandler

Class TCPMessageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uw.cs.cse461.net.tcpmessagehandler.TCPMessageHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TCPMessageHandlerInterface

    public class TCPMessageHandler
extends Object
implements TCPMessageHandlerInterface
    Sends/receives a message over an established TCP connection. To be a message means the unit of write/read is demarcated in some way. In this implementation, that's done by prefixing the data with a 4-byte length field.

    Design note: TCPMessageHandler cannot usefully subclass Socket, but rather must wrap an existing Socket, because servers must use ServerSocket.accept(), which returns a Socket that must then be turned into a TCPMessageHandler.

    Author:
    zahorjan

    • Method Detail

      • intToByte

        protected static byte[] intToByte(int i)
        We need an "on the wire" format for a binary integer. This method encodes into that format, which is little endian (low order bits of int are in element [0] of byte array, etc.).
        Parameters:
        i -
        Returns:
        A byte[4] encoding the integer argument.

      • byteToInt

        protected static int byteToInt(byte[] buf)
        We need an "on the wire" format for a binary integer. This method decodes from that format, which is little endian (low order bits of int are in element [0] of byte array, etc.).
        Parameters:
        buf -
        Returns:
